item.title: What cellphone do you have?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:236, topic:296988”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=393003.msg3418009#msg3418009 date=1291261111]

HTC Hero, with a custom rom so I can install apps to my SD card

Also have a black silicon case on it. Debating on changing to blue or white though.

i havent searched yet but i was wondering what site you go to for htc hero roms, and what kinda roms they have. what does it score on a quadrant benchmark?

I use CyanogenMod on my Motorola Droid, but they also have roms for the HTC Hero:
http://forum.cyanogenmod.com/files/category/1-stable-mod/
[/quote]
ok thanks. i was jw b/c my brother has a hero and its really slow; its only done with 3 or 4 of the benchmark tests for quadrant when mine is already through the first 12. on my moment i flashed 2 roms, a kernel, theme, and boot animation. converted the phone’s fs to ext2 i think, formated my sdcard with the biggest ext3 partition i could. its only a class 2 so its slower than it could be. i have tried to do apps2sd but it looks like it get a bootloop. idk what a bootloop looks like but my phone loads up to the boot animation gets stuck at like 30% starts the boot animation over get stuck in the same spot repeats that until i pull the battery. my phone is much more stable now than it was with the last rom i had on it which was suppose to be stable, and i hardly get a data lock-up anymore. my phone is my source of Internet on the weekdays with the wifi tether app. they are working on a cyanogenmod for the moment right now and android 2.2 which im not sure if thats whats on the cyanogenmod or not. when i go to facebook on my phone it asks if i want to download the facebook app for my Xperia x10. idky maybe it has something to do with my firmware.[/quote]

Cyanogenmod stable is currently 6.0 which is based on Android 2.2, but 6.1 which is based on 2.2.1 is on RC5 already, and very close to release. My phone is still on 6.1 RC3 which I haven’t had any problems with at all.

@bricking phone, you can’t brick your phone if you have something like clockworkmod and make backups before you install new roms.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you have?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:236, topic:296988”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=393003.msg3418009#msg3418009 date=1291261111]

HTC Hero, with a custom rom so I can install apps to my SD card

Also have a black silicon case on it. Debating on changing to blue or white though.

i havent searched yet but i was wondering what site you go to for htc hero roms, and what kinda roms they have. what does it score on a quadrant benchmark?

I use CyanogenMod on my Motorola Droid, but they also have roms for the HTC Hero:
http://forum.cyanogenmod.com/files/category/1-stable-mod/
[/quote]
ok thanks. i was jw b/c my brother has a hero and its really slow; its only done with 3 or 4 of the benchmark tests for quadrant when mine is already through the first 12. on my moment i flashed 2 roms, a kernel, theme, and boot animation. converted the phone’s fs to ext2 i think, formated my sdcard with the biggest ext3 partition i could. its only a class 2 so its slower than it could be. i have tried to do apps2sd but it looks like it get a bootloop. idk what a bootloop looks like but my phone loads up to the boot animation gets stuck at like 30% starts the boot animation over get stuck in the same spot repeats that until i pull the battery. my phone is much more stable now than it was with the last rom i had on it which was suppose to be stable, and i hardly get a data lock-up anymore. my phone is my source of Internet on the weekdays with the wifi tether app. they are working on a cyanogenmod for the moment right now and android 2.2 which im not sure if thats whats on the cyanogenmod or not. when i go to facebook on my phone it asks if i want to download the facebook app for my Xperia x10. idky maybe it has something to do with my firmware.[/quote]
Just watch what you are doing so you don’t end up with a fancy little paperweight. That happened to my friend after I told him not to try a certain rom he was looking at, since it was very buggy. It never installed right and completely bricked his phone.

Read full topic

Everyone buttfucks the htc evo like its a fucking god.

and it’s just such a messy operating system with low quality display, anything that phone can do the iPhone can and will do it better.

i prefer the simplicity and the efficiency of the iPhone.
